Welcome to Sarvajanik College of Engineering and Technology (SCET), established in 1995 as the lead institute of Sarvajanik Education Society (SES), one of the largest philanthropic societies in education in this region since 1912. SCET is now under Sarvajanik University sponsored by SES in 2021. Our experienced faculty is here to provide knowledge and skills to ambitious students for leadership in their field, with opportunities for on-field training and global exposure. We offer facilities for curricular, co-curricular, and extracurricular activities to help students achieve their life goals.... Read More

Chairman's Representative, SCET

Since the inception in 1995, SCET has marked its presence in the field of technical education, research and consultancy. Our students have excelled into various sectors. We welcome the students with a zest to develop their career in engineering and technology to join us and explore the numerous opportunities waiting for them in the core and emerging areas in the engineering and technological domains. It is assured that you will be provided with the best of the facilities for education as well as research.... Read More

The entire faculty and ever inspiring mentors leaves no stone unturned to shpae one's future. Huge respect, love and devotion for entire faculty members and department.

SCET has offered me limitless opportunities to build my career and grow as a person. Their unique learning environment has always inspired me to achive more than just educational qualification.

The three tremendous years gave me a lot great exposure and grasping opportunities to discover my knowledge and talent.

I was fortunate to attend this college which has really boosted my vital skills and helped me to grow as a person. I am thankful to all facilities who have enhanced my academic learning experience.

“There is no such thing as a special category of science called Applied Science, there is Science and its applications, which are related to one another as the fruit is related to the tree that has borne it.”

Truly believing in the aforementioned quote of Louis Pasteur, the Department of Applied Science and Humanities (ASH) is devoted to foster the fundamental principles and understanding of Science that are capable of enhancing the human experience.

ASH Department plays a vital role in catering the teaching of basic Sciences and Humanities Courses for engineering students of all the branches. The department endeavours to lay a strong foundation of various disciplines such as; Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Communication Skills or English, Management and Physical Education in the mind of aspirant engineers, so that they can advance to rest of their years of study with Cutting-Edge Knowledge.

Consisted of  'Adequate and highly qualified faculty members', the department boasts of four well-equipped laboratories proficient to render the practical aspects of the courses. Dedicated faculties of the department strives to inculcate the basic engineering, communicative and managerial skills, which are indispensable part of any professional office.

The department organizes seminars, guest lectures, workshops, short term trainings and aptitude testson regular basis.

To apply sound knowledge of fundamental physics to create concrete base of engineering.

To develop computational and problem solving skills by analytical techniques of mathematics.

To enhance awareness of environmental conservation and efficient use of natural resources by environmental studies and to serve society at large.

To develop relation between material science and engineering with the use of fundamental chemistry.

To build up students’ communication, interpersonal, managerial and life skills for their bright personal and professional life.

To raise self-discipline, spontaneous sills and team spirit by various sports activities.

To inspire the students for conceptual Knowledge of core subjects and enhance their mental, physical and independent problem solving skill to become best in their professional field.

Aims to lead the aspiring engineers in the field of innovation and ideation by strengthening interpersonal, analytical and core engineering skills through interdisciplinary career-focused practical education with effective use of modern teaching methodologies.

The mission statement of Chemical Engineering Department is “To be a Center of Excellence in Chemical Engineering Education which is Industry Relevant, Globally Competitive and Socially Sound”. Department was started from the very first year of the inception of Institute in 1995. Chemical Engineering Department of SCET was accredited by NBA in 2006. The department zealously strives to provide students, the exposure to industrial environment by way of Industrial training, expert lectures and Plant visits. Seminars and workshops are organized frequently to hone their technical and soft skills. The students undergo an extensive course work and extensive laboratory practice in all conventional and advanced areas of Chemical Engineering. In addition, students are involved in significant number of Industry projects where they get a chance to solve problem from Industry and interact with their future employers. As SCET is located in the heart of one of the Chemical hubs of the state, Chemical Engineering students get a chance to interact with local chemical companies and get connected through summer internships and regular plant visits to industries in the vicinity of the city and state. Also there are many students who opt for higher studies at Universities in India and abroad. In order to enhance the knowledge and develop research cult in faculties as well as students different National level events such as National Conference, Symposiums and Short term training programs are organized on the regular basis.

To be a centre of excellence in Chemical Engineering education and research which is industrially relevant and globally competitive.

1. To augment student performance by providing advanced technical knowledge and excellent laboratory infrastructure. 2. To enhance field exposure and research through interaction with public/private sectors and alumni. 3. To create professionals inculcated with innovative ethical thinking, scientific approach and collectively contribute to a society at large.

1. The chief aim of the course is to improve the student’s knowledge in the field of unit operations and unit processes applied in chemical industries, its commissioning and implementation. 2. Enhance the student’s skills in the field of manufacturing of chemicals and identifying-solving major engineering problems associated with it thereby developing them professionally. 3. Cultivate analytical thinking and thereby increase their adaptability of students for changing and upgrading technologies. 4. Provide overall development of the students so that they are able to pursue higher studies, become entrepreneurs or work in harmony with the industries. 5. To inculcate professional ethics and positive attitude and ability to become an upright citizen with a sense of social responsibility towards environment

Engineering Graduates will be able to: PO1 Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems. PO2 Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences. PO3 Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations. PO4 Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions. PO5 Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations. PO6 The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice. PO7 Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development. PO8 Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice. PO9 Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings. PO10 Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions. PO11 Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments. PO12 Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

The Computer Engineering Department was established in 1997 with an intake of 30 students in B. E. (Computer Engineering) and had been offering a PG course, ME (CSE), since 2012 also. Currently, Computer Engineering Department offers two AICTE approved courses:

B.Tech. (Computer Engineering) with an intake of 180 students.

M.Tech, (CSE-AIML) with an intake of 12 students.

The department offers a bachelor's degree in computer engineering that covers the latest technologies in various domains aligned with the industries’ demand. The department continues the journey towards "The goal of creating technical excellence which imparts the best knowledge and skills to students with the objective of producing high calibre engineering graduates". A sound theoretical and practical work prepares the students in a wider area of computer engineering.

The department provides high-quality technical education to its students, supported by state-of-the-art computing facilities, a highly qualified teaching staff with excellent retention rates, and dedicated support staff who are always ready to inculcate the best knowledge to the students.

There are six well-equipped laboratories in the department. The ultimate laboratory facility along with unlimited internet access helps the upcoming computer engineer to come out with a bright future. The department always strives for providing excellent and modernized laboratory facilities to the students.

More Information about the department can be found at the Intranet Link .

Experienced faculty members with more than 65% either Ph.D or pursuing Ph.D

All the faculty members on permanent roll

Highest staff retention ratio among self-finance institutes of the entire Gujarat state

A good number of patents and copyrights published/granted/registered

Financial support for students publications, project competitions, hackathons etc.

Good focus on the overall grooming of the students through various active clubs and student chapters

Good academic performance of the students across the state .

Students recognized at lead positions for - NASA SpaceApp Hackathon, Alexa Influencer, Microsoft Student Partner, Google Developer Student Clubs (DSC)

Most of the alumni are placed in reputed MNCs with handsome packages or pursuing their masters from esteemed universities in countries like US, Europe and Canada.

To evolve as a premiere center in the field of computer engineering for developing globally competent and credible engineers with best of the technical knowledge, research and innovations skills who contribute meaningfully to a sustainable society.

To develop the student with a strong foundation of scientific methods and computer engineering through excellence in teaching-learning, research and innovation.

To produce global competency in the department of computer engineering to address emerging challenges in real-life sectors through continuous learning.

To provide students technical and value-based education resulting in entrepreneurs and notable citizens.

Graduates of Computer Engineering will be able to apply the acquired in-depth theoretical and practical knowledge to

PEO1: Exhibit proficiency in modeling, designing and implementing computing systems with real world constraints.

PEO2: Provide solutions to challenging problems by applying their knowledge of Mathematics, Computer Engineering and scientific methods in multi-disciplinary areas.

PEO3: Take up higher studies, research and development, entrepreneurship with adaptability to changing global work environment instilled with technical proficiency, critical thinking, team work, leadership and effective communication.

PEO4: Contribute to economic growth by developing innovative ideas with appropriate considerations of societal and environmental needs by exercising their professional knowledge and ethical responsibility.

Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals and computer engineering specialization to the solution of the complex engineering problems.

Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems based on mathematics, natural sciences and engineering sciences.

Design solutions, system components or processes that meet the specified needs of the societal, and environment considerations.

Use research-based knowledge that includes design and conduct of experiments as well as analysis and interpretation of data.

Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

Apply professional engineering practice after assessment and reasoning of societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues.

Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions on society and environment to identify the need for sustainable development.

Understand the ethical principles and commit to professional ethics.

Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams.

Communicate effectively by means of writing effective reports, designing documentations, making effective presentations, and managing flow of instructions.

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering as well as management principles by applying them to projects in multidisciplinary environments.

To apply the technical skills to succeed in life-long learning.

Programme Specific Outcomes (PSO)

PSO1: To provide students with sufficient breadth in mathematics, basic science fundamentals, software, modern engineering tools, and equipments to analyze and solve computing problems and also to pursue higher studies and research.

PSO2: An ability to design, develop and implement computer programs in the area related to system software, database, information retrieval, website design, multimedia, and networking with standard practices and strategies in software project development.

PSO3: Analyze, design, implement and validate software/hardware based solutions using standard practices and strategies as well in groups.

The Electrical Engineering Department is led by a strong team of qualified, dedicated, and experienced faculty members of 2 Professors, 6 Associate Professors, and 5 Assistant Professors with a profound passion for teaching. We impart quality teaching using pedagogical methodologies, tools, and techniques to relate theory and practical aspects of complex topics. The department has well-equipped all essential laboratories like Electrical Machines, Control Systems, Measurement and Instrumentation, Power systems, Microprocessor, Power Electronics, and Computer Laboratory with necessary licensed simulation software packages. The department always motivates and supports the complete development of students and emphasizes life-long learning, skill development, and employability.

To impart excellent education in Electrical Engineering that coincides today’s need of industry.

To empower budding engineers in achieving educational goals, promote entrepreneurship skills and assist to develop leadership skills for success in professional fields.

To inculcate habits amongst students for ethical attitude and constructive contribution for the benefit of the society and to become global citizens.

The graduate from the Department of Electrical Engineering is expected PEO1: To demonstrate broad knowledge of electrical engineering technology to support design, application, installation, manufacturing, operation, and maintenance of not only electrical but also other diversified areas like electronic, computer and instrumentation system. PEO2: To display the creative and critical reasoning skills to solve technical problems, ethically and responsibly, in benefit of society. PEO3: To exhibit professional attitude, effective communication skills, team work skill and an ability to thrive in multi-disciplinary and diverse fields. PEO4: To pursue professional development, including continuing or advanced education relevant to his/her career path and to motivate for life-long learning.

Upon successful completion of the programme, electrical engineering graduates are expected to PO1: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems. PO2: Identify, formulate, and analyze complex engineering problems based on fundamentals and principles of engineering to suggest practical solutions. PO3: Apply critical thinking in designing and validating components, processes and systems especially related to Electrical Engineering. PO4: Design and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data. PO5: Design and analyze Electrical and/or multidisciplinary systems with an aid of suitable modern application tools/packages. PO6: Apply professional engineering knowledge based on assessment and reasoning for societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues. PO7: Evaluate the consequences of engineering and technological advancement on environment and need for sustainable development. PO8: Value professional, ethical and social responsibilities and an impact of engineering on society. PO9: Work effectively as an individual and in team. PO10: Communicate effectively by means of effective report writing, drafting, making effective presentations, and managing flow of instructions. PO11: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles by applying them to projects in multidisciplinary environments. PO12: Develop confidence for self-educators and life-long learners.

Program Specific Outcomes (PSOs)

Graduate electrical engineer will be able to PSO1: Analyze, design and implement ideas and skills of electrical engineering independently and in groups to meet industrial and societal needs. PSO2: Use recent simulation and programming tools for analysis of electrical circuits and systems. PSO3: Evaluate clean energy options, energy efficient solutions and other alternatives for sustainable development

Electronics & Communication Engineering

Electronics & Communication Engineering

The Department of Electronics & Communication was established in the year 1995. At present the Department is offering Undergraduate Program in the field of Electronics and Communication as well as Post Graduate program in the field of Communication Systems. The departmental facilities including latest laboratory equipment's, communication kits and modules, fibre optic kits, microwave bench etc. enabled the department to be a front-runner amongst Institutes offering courses in Electronics and Communication. The curriculum is based on latest views as needed by industries and research departments. There are seven well-equipped laboratories in the department. The ultimate laboratory facility along with unlimited internet access helps the upcoming electronics engineer to come out with bright future. The department consists of highly capable teaching and non-teaching staff who are always ready to enculcate the best knowledge to the students. The department always strives for providing excellent and modernizes laboratory facilities to the students.

The department of Electronics and Communication devotes itself and its resources to develop intellectually capable for the development of the society.

The department dedicates its strength to develop skilful and innovative professionals.

To cultivate entrepreneurial and leadership quality for the benefit of the society.

PEO1: Exhibit an in-depth theoretical and practical knowledge of various engineering aspects and strongly frame their fundamentals for progressing career.

PEO2: Develop the proficiency with the techniques of Mathematics and ability to evaluate logical arguments to tackle the real world challenges.

PEO3: Develop innovative ideas pertaining to technical problems based on simulations and various software means.

PEO4: Establish oneself as Effective Professionals with attention to team- work, leadership, effective communication, critical thinking and problem solving skills within a global, societal and environmental context

PEO5: Enhance the performance in multi-disciplinary organization and achieve professional advancement with increasing responsibilities and ethical ramifications

PO1: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems (Engineering knowledge).

PO2: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems ( Problem analysis).

PO3: Design solutions for complex engineering problems with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety.( Design/development of solutions)

PO4: Use research-based knowledge to provide valid conclusions. (Conduct investigations of complex problems)

PO5: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT simulator tools with an understanding of the limitations. (Modern tool usage)

PO6: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice. ( The engineer and society)

PO7: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and need for sustainable development. ( Environment and sustainability)

PO8: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.( Ethics)

PO9: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams. ( Individual and team work)

PO10: Communicate effectively with the engineering community and with society at large and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations. (Communication)

PO11: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments. ( Project management and finance)

PO12: Recognize the need for, and lifelong learning in the broadest context of technological change.(Life-long learning)

The graduate from the department will be able to,

PSO1: Describe, analyse, implement and test different analog, digital and mixed signal circuits.

PSO2: write, simulate and debug assembly and higher level program for both analog and digital circuits and systems.

PSO3: Design and measure critical performance parameters of electronics and communications systems.

The Department of Information Technology Engineering, established in 2001 provides one of the best learning opportunities to students with its contemporary course design and curriculum and by providing state-of-art learning resources.

The IT department currently offers two AICTE approved courses of engineering:

(i) BTech(Information Technology) with an intake of 120 students and

(ii) BTech(Artificial Intelligence and Data Science) with an intake of 60 students

The Department of Information Technology has dedicated, fully-qualified and highly experienced teaching faculty who are committed towards nurturing young IT professionals of the next generation. The department has spacious, well-equipped laboratories with latest computer systems and other resources like laptops, projectors, graphics processing unit and wireless devices in addition to a continuous, high-speed Internet access to facilitate the curriculum’s practical implementation and project-development work.

The I.T. Department regularly organizes seminars, guest lectures, workshops, short term trainings and programming contests for students to expand their knowledge and skill set beyond the regular curriculum. We encourage our students to work on innovative and industry-applicable projects so that they can become the most highly sought after I.T. graduates in the country.

Vibrant Learning and Research Environment

Jobs for students in reputed MNCs through Campus placement assistance like TCS, Wipro, Cognizant etc.

Scholarships for Meritorious students

Experienced and Qualified permanent faculty members holding Ph.D. and M.Tech degrees

Selection as Student ambassadors in International companies like TCS-India and SAP-Germany

IT students have been granted projects under SSIP (Student Startup and Innovation Policy) by Government of Gujarat

Consistently good academic records of students with gold medals as branch toppers at GTU

To evolve as a global center of excellence in the field of Information Technology imparting technical education and professional ethics to thrive in an era of globalization.

To impart sound technical knowledge in the field of Information Technology through a creative balance of academic, research and co-curricular activities.

To cultivate professional ethics and soft skills in the student for global competitiveness.

To collaborate with industries, government entities and other academic institutions to bring socially responsible, sustainable IT solutions to the world.

The educational objectives of the Information Technology program are designed to produce competent engineers who are ready to contribute effectively to the advancement of Information Technology causes and to accommodate the needs of the profession. The highlights of the objectives include:

Endorse the practice of Information Technology in the general disciplines of design, development and deployment of software and integration of existing technologies.

Teach the application of fundamental engineering skills and specialized computing knowledge to provide feasible solutions to problems in various areas of IT.

Provide knowledge to students beyond the prescribed curriculum.

Regular organization of technical guest-lectures, programming contests, various quiz, seminars, short-term training programme, conference, workshops and cultural programme for an all-round development of students.

Engineering Graduates will be able to:

Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including design, modeling and visualization to engineering problems with an understanding of the limitations.

Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.

Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.

Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects in multidisciplinary environments.

Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

Develop and deploy efficient algorithms to solve engineering problems .

Design, code, validate and test various application and system software and evaluate the performance based on performance metrics for software systems .

Perform information retrieval and processing for real-time applications.

Instrumentation & Control (IC) Engineering Department is established in 1997 with sanctioned intake of 30 under Veer Narmad South Gujarat University. Now under Gujarat Technological University, the sanctioned intake is 60. With Excellent Laboratory and Class Rooms facility the IC department has well experienced and skilled teaching and non teaching staff. I &C department is running ISA Student chapter under which activities like expert talk, alumni talk and other technical and non-technical activities are carried out. I & C department is organizing industrial visits and also encouraging students for vocational training in various industries. With the joint effort of T & P cell and I & C department, our students are placed at reputed industries like L&T, L&T Infotech, Reliance Industries Ltd., ABB Ltd., Essar Steel, Bhabha Atomic Research Center (BARC), DRDO, Shell, YOKOGAWA to name a few. Many of our students have completed further studies in foreign countries and got very well jobs.

To endeavor for excellence in the field of Instrumentation & Control Engineering through innovative teaching, research and industry academia collaboration.

To set up the mechanism for quality education in the field of Instrumentation & control Engineering to meet the industrial requirements.

To establish a research environment for societal benefit through industrial interaction.

To inculcate entrepreneurial attitude, professional ethics and human values among learners.

Graduate will apply fundamental knowledge and skills in solving real world

Graduate will apply standard industry practices and emerging technologies to

analyze, design, develop, and implement the state-of-the art solutions. (Breadth)

Graduate will be accepted into higher studies or become employable by

exhibiting effective communication skills, teamwork , ethical attitude, and

demonstrate a pursuit of lifelong learning. (professionalism and preparation)

After completion of this four year graduate level program in Instrumentation & Control Engineering students will be capable to acquire the following qualities.

PO 1: Apply knowledge of Mathematics, Science and Engineering to Instrumentation and Control Discipline to solve complex engineering problems.

PO 2: Identify, formulate, review research literature and analyse complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions with the fundamentals of mathematics, engineering and science.

PO 3: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components that meet the specified requirements with considerations for the public health and safety and environmental considerations.

PO 4: Use research based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

PO 5: Create, select and apply appropriate techniques, resources and modern engineering and software tools including prediction and modelling complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

PO 6: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess public health, safety, communication and other legal issues relevant to the professional engineering practice.

PO 7: Evaluate the impact of the professional engineering solutions in social and environmental contexts and provide sustainable development of systems.

PO 8: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.

PO 9: Function effectively as an individual and a member or a leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

PO 10: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as being able to write comprehensive and effective reports with impressive presentation and communication skills.

PO 11: Demonstrate acquired skills of engineering and management and apply these to one’s own work as a member or leader to carry out multidisciplinary projects.

Program Specific Outcomes (PSO)

A Graduate Engineer will be able to

PSO 1: design, develop, select, test, calibrate, install and integrate Instrumentation and Control systems.

PSO 2: model, simulate and analyse systems and control methodologies to cater the needs of the core industrial problems.

PSO 3: synthesize new ideas by integrating emerging technologies to provide solutions for the real life applications.

Artifical Intelligence & Data Science

Electronics & Communication Engineering

Department of Master of Computer Application has commenced from the year 2009 at the Sarvajanik College of Engineering & Technology. The MCA department currently offers two AICTE approved PG programs: (i) MCA with an intake of 120 students and (ii) Integrated MCA with an intake of 60 students

The Department provides high valued technical education to its students with the help of its state-of-the-art computing facilities. The Department has relatively young, yet, experienced and dynamic team comprising of Assistant Professors and lecturers, headed by scholarly Head of Department.

The Department has proved its competence as an educational institute by standing 1st in year 2011 and 2nd in year 2012 in final year exams amongst all colleges under GTU.

The Department is equipped with latest hi-tech hardware and software facilities and other peripherals. The Department has three computer laboratories and a server room which is also under the guidance of experienced Lab Assistant.

The Department provides full support for Training and Placement of its final year students.

Along with the latest curriculum, the Department also organizes Vivacity – A Tech Fest for the all round development of its students. The Department has bi annually technical Magazine INFORMATICA, covering articles on latest information technology and computer science world. The Department also organizes workshops on latest emerging trends of IT industry conducted by expertise professionals from the industry, which provides an edge over for the students.

This course is affiliated to the Sarvajanik University from Academic year 2021.

To impart quality education in the field of Computer Science and Applications for crafting competent IT professionals, entrepreneurs, academicians, capable to withstand rapidly changing global challenges with human values at the core.

To achieve excellence in teaching by providing state-of-the-art infrastructure and computing facilities.

To improve learning capabilities by the use of Information and Communication Technologies.

To prepare skillful, trained IT professionals and entrepreneurs by imparting education through workshops, seminars, expert lectures and competitions.

To bridge the gap between industry and academia by providing platform for interaction with the industries,professionals and alumni.

To sensitize cultural and moral values in students for betterment of society.

Programme Educational Objectives (PEOs)

The Programme Educational Objectives of MCA Department are:

To create professionals proficient in Problem Solving and Analytical Skills, System Applications and Developments, Analysis and Design, Project Management and Testing.

To instill a curve in students for continuous learning by upgrading them with latest technologies.

To nurture the self-confidence and boost morale for taking Entrepreneurship.

To provide a competitive bench for enhancing personality, team spirit, leadership qualities and enthusiasm by organizing technical, cultural and social events.

To kindle the urge in students to contribute towards betterment of the society by becoming well-educated, civilized, morally-upright and responsible citizens.

The Programme Outcomes of MCA Department are:

Graduates with the ability to understand and confer fundamentals of computer science

Graduates fused with knowledge of contemporary and modern technologies.

Graduates possessing skills to analyze the problem related to real world scenarios from field of computer science.

Graduates with a command to evaluate real world computer science related problems with reasonable and practical solutions.

Graduates having an additional edge towards computing problems related to research.

Graduates with an ability to adapt the use of newer and modern technologies and have valor to pursue them after understanding the limitations of the same.

Graduates having decisiveness and capability of working in team.

Graduates ready to challenge their limits and have readiness in learning newer skills.

Graduates possessing managerial and team leader skills required in software industries.

Graduates possessing fluent and effective communication skills.

Graduates crafted as upright citizens servicing the society and contribute towards sustainable development.

Graduates efficient to work in team and efficiently with the roles defined by his peers.

Graduates with the expertise to successfully start and manage their own business.

Artifical Intelligence & Data Science

We offer an undergraduate program in Mechanical Engineering that was approved by AICTE (All India Council for Technical Education) and affiliated with GTU (Gujarat Technological University) earlier. The program started in the academic year 2018-19 and is now affiliated with Sarvajanik University from the academic year 2021. Our courses are designed to cultivate creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial skills, emphasizing their practical application to engineering and technological problems.

Our department boasts a dynamic faculty and experienced support staff, providing a wide range of technical expertise and a breadth of academic focus.

We have well-established laboratories including the Basic Workshop, Manufacturing Process, Fluid Mechanics and Hydraulic Machinery Laboratory, Computer Aided Design (CAD), Dynamics of Machinery, Mechanical Measurement and Metrology, Basic Mechanical Engineering, Material Science and Metallurgy, Automobile Engineering. The department is also equipped with good computational facilities. To keep up with new technologies, our department offers a variety of discipline Electives covering a wide range of subjects.

In the global context, engineering students should be familiar with courses from various branches and advanced subjects within their chosen field. To supplement this, our university has introduced an academic initiative by offering Honors and Minors to undergraduate students enrolled in the B. Tech. Program. In the Department of Mechanical Engineering, we offer Three Honors in specific domains of:

Computer Aided Design/Computer Aided Manufacturing (CAD/CAM),

Advances in Automobile Engineering.

Additionally, the Institute offers 24 Minors such as:

Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning

Electrical Vehicles, and many more.

More information available at: https://scet.ac.in/pages/honors-minors/

We are committed to the growth and betterment of our students, imparting quality education for their co-curricular development and providing motivation and guidance for their extra-curricular activities. This fosters their personality, perception, vision, and work culture, making them competent employees and employers. Throughout their academic journey, we provide experiential learning opportunities, encouraging students to think creatively and collaborate both inside and outside the classroom, putting theoretical ideas to the test in real situations.

We welcome you with humbleness to explore our website to learn more about us and what we have to offer.

To become a leading school renowned for technical education, transformative science, and advances in educating the next generation of Mechanical Engineers who will contribute to the development of a prosperous and advanced society.

To develop technically qualified, innovative and visionary Mechanical Engineering practitioners for the advancement of science and technology through education, research, global consulting, and industry-academia collaboration.

Graduate engineer will be able to

Explain, experiment, analyze and validate the principles and applications of various fluid, thermal, production and energy based systems with quality and safety measures.

Design and analyze different mechanical systems with the aid of current computing and analysis software.

Apply their technical, managerial and other soft skills in research-innovation work, startups and higher studies to become a responsible technocrat and excel in their professional life.

Engineering Graduates will be able to:

PO 1 (Engineering knowledge) Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

PO 2 (Problem analysis) Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

PO 3 (Design / development of solutions) Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

PO 4 (Conduct investigations of complex problems) Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

PO 5 (Modern tool usage) Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

PO 6 (The engineer and society) Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

PO 7 (Environment and sustainability) Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.

PO 8 (Ethics) Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice.

PO 9 (Individual and team work) Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

PO 10 (Communication) Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

PO 11 (Project management and finance) Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multi-disciplinary environments.

PO 12 (Life- long learning) Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.

Artifical Intelligence & Data Science

Electronics & Communication Engineering

The Department of Textile Technology, was established with the pioneering contribution from The Surat Art Silk Cloth Manufacturers Association (SASCMA) in 1995. It should be noted that inspite of Textiles being so important to Indian economy, Textile department is available at very few institutes not only in the state but across the country and SCET is proud to have one with it.

Strategically located in Textile city Surat, which is buzzing with textile activity, the department is fast earning reputation as an important centre for quality Textile education as well as an important centre for textile activities in the city.

The program is designed to provide the student with a thorough background in fundamental concepts of scientific, technological, and management principles, and ability to define and solve challenging problems related to textiles. An essential component of the department’s mission is the development of new knowledge through innovative ideas and the subsequent transfer of this knowledge to both the textile industry and society.

The department has a relatively young, yet experienced and dynamic team with one professor with Ph.D., four associate professors and other assistant professors mostly having master’s degree.

To achieve excellency in textile education & research and produce competent technocrats meeting industry needs paving way to progressive civilization.

To create atmosphere of learning in which students acquire comprehensive knowledge with a multi disciplinary approach.

To promote research, creativity, innovation and professional activities.

To forge relationship with reputed institutes, industries and government bodies for  the benefit of society at large.

Two to three years after matriculation, the graduate of the Department of Textile Technology from SCET will be able to:

PEO1: Synthesis data & technical concepts for application and product development.

PEO2: Work as part of teams of multidisciplinary projects.

PEO3: Use a sound foundation about raw materials, yarn & fabric engineering fundamentals necessary for design and development.

PEO4: Apply knowledge gained for professional issues in textile engineering including ethics, issues related to the global economy and emerging technologies and fostering of important job related skills such as improved oral and written communications and experience in working in teams at a number of levels.

PEO5: Prepare for successful careers in Industry that meet the needs of Indian & Multinational companies.

Graduates will demonstrate basic knowledge in mathematics, science & engineering.

Graduates will demonstrate the ability to identity various fibrous raw materials and thus have the ability for design and product development.

Graduates will demonstrate the ability to function on engineering & science laboratory as well as on multidisciplinary tasks.

Graduates are expected to identify, formulate & solve engineering problems.

Graduates are expected to possess ability to use the techniques, skills and modern engineering tools necessary for engineering practice.

Graduates are expected to have the broad education necessary to understand the impact of engineering in a global, economic and social context and should be able to communicate effectively.

Graduates will be broadly expected to understand the impact of engineering on society and demonstrate awareness on contemporary issues.

Graduates are expected to learn all basic aspects of textile manufacturing process.

Graduates are expected to function effectively individually and on teams, including diverse and multidisciplinary, to accomplish a common goal.

Graduates are expected to communicate effectively with a range of audiences.

Graduates are expected to recognise the need for and an ability to engage in continuing professional development.

Graduates are expected to understand engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects.

Programme Specific Outcomes ( PSOs ):

Engineering Graduates will be able to –

1. Design and develop the processes followed for yarn formation, yarn preparation for weaving, fabric formation and allied textiles as per the requirements of textile industries.

2. Monitor various textile processes leading towards the production of yarn and/or fabric to meet with the required quality standards.

3. Learn and adopt new technological changes taken place in international market to create a new career path as an entrepreneur.

Artifical Intelligence & Data Science

Electronics & Communication Engineering

1] Application for the Engineering course: The admission to these courses are centralized, so the candidate has to apply to the Admission Committee for Professional courses (ACPC) in their prescribed forms within prescribed time limit. These forms can be registered online from the help centers notified by the ACPC. For more information please refer Admission Committee for professional Courses (Technical) L. D. College of Engineering Campus Ahmedabad - 380 015, (ACPC) website: www.jacpcldce.ac.in, E-mail: ldceindia@gmail.com , Phone: 079-26304118/26300360, Fax No. : 079-26304118 2] Application for the Architecture course: Admission to Architecture is done through State Architecture Admissions in Gujarat (SAAG) at CEPT, Ahmedabad. Kasturbhai Lalbhai Campus, University Road, Navrangpura, Ahmedabad - 380 009. Phone No. : 079-26302470/26302452, Fax No. 079-26302075. For more information please refer website of CEPT: www.cept.ac.in and E-mail: cept@ad1.vsnl.net.in 3] Application for Master of Architecture course: Applications will be invited by way of advertisement. On the basis of applications received committee nominated by Veer Narmad South Gujarat University will finalize the admissions. 4] Application for Master of Computer Applications course: Application form details for this course and details of GCET examination shall be available on GTU website; On the basis of merit obtained the admission shall be finalized by GTU. The website for GTU is www.gtu.ac.in 5] Application for Master of Engineering Applications course: Admission to M.E. is done through ACPC, L. D. College of Engineering Campus, Opp Gujarat University, Ahmedabad. Phone No. : 079-26302470/26302452, Fax No. 079-26302075. For more information please refer website of ACPC: www.jacpcldce.ac.in

2. What is the facility for Hostel?

Hostel: There is a separate hostel for boys and girls at five minutes walking distance from campus.

3. Details regarding Training & Placement Cell

Liasion with various industries, organization and institutions.

Assists students for summer training.

Co-ordinates between organization and the institution for arrangement, planning and execution of campus interviews.

Provides all necessary facilities to the visiting team during campus interview.

Organizes study tour programme.

4. What is the process for Diploma to Degree Admission?

Diploma students can secure direct admission to the second year (3rd semester) of the above engineering courses, based on 10% of the total intake. Admissions are conducted online through a centralized procedure managed by ACPC. Aspirants must appear for the DDCET, conducted by the government.

For more information, please visit the ACPC website: www.jacpcldce.ac.in

5. Quota for reservations of seats?

As per the norms of State Government seats are reserved for the residents of Gujarat as under: A) Scheduled Caste Students-07% B) Scheduled Tribe Students-15% C) Socially & Educationally Backward-27% D) EWS-10%

6. How will the Merit List of Engineering be considered?

Merit list: The merit list will be prepared as per the notification issued by ACPC.

7. When was the college established?

SCET was one of the first self-financed engineering colleges in the state. The college was established in 1995 and is presently one of the constituent institutes of Sarvajanik University

SCET is a premier technical education institute offering UG and PG courses in Engineering, MCA, and IMCA, along with a B.Tech. program for working professionals

B.Tech. (Chemical Engineering) B.Tech. (Electronics & Communication Engineering) B.Tech. (Computer Engineering) B.Tech. (Electrical Engineering) B.Tech. (Instrumentation & Control Engineering) B.Tech. (Information Technology) B.Tech. (Civil Engineering) B.Tech. (Mechanical Engineering) B.Tech. (Artificial Intelligence & Data Science)

M.Tech. Computer Science & Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning) M.Tech. (Environmental Engineering) M.Tech. Town & Country Planning M.Tech. Civil (Structural Engineering)

Masters in Computer Applications Integrated MCA

B.Tech. (Electrical Engineering) for Working Professionals B.Tech. (Civil Engineering) for Working Professionals B.Tech. (Computer Engineering) for Working Professionals

9. What is the eligibility for admission in Engineering?

Eligibility for admission is determined by the Government of Gujarat in accordance with AICTE guidelines. The online admission process is conducted centrally by ACPC ( www.jacpcldce.ac.in ) every year.

10. What is the eligibility for admission in Master of Computer Applications?

Eligibility criteria will be as per ACPC Guidelines ( www.jacpcldce.ac.in )

11. What is the process for Convocation?

12. What is the eligibility for admission in Master of Technology?

Eligibility criteria will be as per ACPC Guidelines ( www.jacpcldce.ac.in )

13. What facilities can be availed at Library?

14. What is the process to pay the fees?

The students of 2nd, 3rd & 4th year are required to pay the tuition fees annually or term-wise in prescribed form available with Account section within 15 days of the opening of the odd & even semester respectively.

Even the students of 1st year who have paid the half yearly fees have to pay the remaining fees at the opening of the second term. The fee structure is subject to changes as per the rules of Fee Regulatory Committee.

15. Is there any Scholarship / Fund / Gold Medal Facility?

Scholarships such as SC, ST, and SEBC, provided by the government, as well as MYSY and other state and central scholarships, are available to students through the National Scholarship Portal. Interest-free loan scholarships are also available at the institute. GATE scholarship is available for PG students. Moreover, Sarvajanik University offers several other scholarships. Gold medals are awarded to meritorious students in each course every year.

16. What is SCET's affiliation and background?

What is SCET's affiliation and background?

SCET is one of the constituent institutes of Sarvajanik University, which was established by the century-old philanthropic Sarvajanik Education Society, providing high-quality education.

NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 – Surat Edition

NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 – Surat Edition

NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 – Surat Edition

NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 – Surat Edition The Computer Engineering Department of Sarvajanik College of Engineering and Technology (SCET), a constituent of Sarvajanik University, hosted the NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 – Surat. The event brought together innovators, students, developers, designers, and enthusiasts from diverse regions to solve real-world challenges using NASA’s open data resources. This year’s Surat Edition witnessed remarkable participation, with over 500 participants forming teams and submitting 81 innovative projects. Participants joined not only from Surat but also from across India and beyond, representing regions such as Spiti, Hyderabad, Aurangabad, Rajasthan, Amravati, Nashik, Nepal, Columbia, Germany, Los Angeles, and New York. This diversity underscored the event’s global reach and spirit of collaboration. In preparation for the hackathon, the organizing committee at SCET conducted a series of orientation sessions and a comprehensive bootcamp, aimed at equipping participants with the skills and insights necessary to perform at their best. The Bootcamp Series featured expert-led sessions on a variety of topics, including: - “Space Stories: From Data to Public Understanding” by Mr. Shakoor Rather, CEO of ScienceMatters. - “Vibe Coding” by Mr. Prashant Bhardwaj, Innovation Manager at CRIF. - “Decentralizing Space” by Mr. Jason Michaud, CEO of StarDust Technologies. - “Building Space Apps on the Web: Tools for the Next Generation” by Mr. Nishant Painter, Founder of Shivanttra. - “Prototype to Pitch” by Ms. Rashmi Sheoran, ISRO Space Tutor. These sessions inspired participants to think critically, innovate boldly, and prepare their projects for global recognition. Following the successful completion of the event, 9 teams from the Surat Edition were selected as Global Nominees, earning the opportunity to compete at the international level. This prestigious recognition highlights the excellence, creativity, and technical competence demonstrated by participants from Surat on the global stage. The theme for NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025 was “Learn, Launch, and Lead”, encouraging participants to learn collaboratively, launch innovative solutions, and lead change through technology and teamwork. The Surat Edition was led by a dedicated organizing team comprising: - Chairperson: Dr. Dipali Kasat, (Head, Computer Engineering Department, SCET) - Faculty Lead: Prof. Dhatri Pandya (Professor, Computer Engineering Department, SCET) - Event Lead: Parth Lathiya, (B.Tech IV, Computer Engineering Department, SCET) - Event Co-Leads: Anika Mehta, Satyam Tiwari, Jit Prajapati and Jay Reshamwala The successful organization of the hackathon reaffirmed SCET’s commitment to innovation, global engagement, and interdisciplinary collaboration.

About the International Relations Cell

About the International Relations Cell

About the International Relations Cell

To achieve technological excellence in Engineering education, the International Relations Cell (IR Cell) aims to promote intensive academic and research partnerships and collaborations with leading higher education institutes, universities and industries across the globe. The primary objective of such International partnerships and collaborations is to provide our students with the most enriching global academic exposure to bridge the global knowledge gap.  IR Cell creates avenues of opportunities for students by organising a wide range of events like Student Exchange Programs, Internship in Foreign Organizations, Global Excursions, Summer Schools in Foreign Universities, and many more with an intent to amplify our academic rigor and cultural wisdom. Through such events, our students get the unique opportunity to learn from eminent professors and universities abroad.  Such events not only bring more cross-cultural work exposure and global opportunities to students, but also enhance their global professional network.

The key objectives of IR Cell are:

To promote relationships with foreign institutes and organizations through strategic partnerships.

To promote relationships with foreign institutes and organizations through strategic partnerships.

To foster and coordinate academic and research collaborations through Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)

To foster and coordinate academic and research collaborations through Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)

To facilitate and coordinate Outbound Mobility Programs to provide our students and faculties with enriching global exposure

To facilitate and coordinate Outbound Mobility Programs to provide our students and faculties with enriching global exposure

To facilitate and coordinate Inbound Mobility Programs to provide international students with the most enriching learning and cultural diversities of India

To facilitate and coordinate Inbound Mobility Programs to provide international students with the most enriching learning and cultural diversities of India

As one of the finest institutions for technical education and research, SCET has a tradition of academic excellence and innovation. The academic atmosphere at the Institute is a rare blend of modern day technical skills and the traditional emphasis on imparting knowledge. Students get exposed to the highest quality of engineering education and research as well as an environment that instills in them a high caliber to achieve in whatever field they choose. The continuous assessment of our students, with particular emphasis on tutorials leads to continuous learning. SCET also has a number of well equipped laboratories with state of the art facilities.

It is customary to accompany classroom learning with hand-on-practical and often with research internship or industrial projects. Each department is offering industry sponsored project to expose their knowledge towards Real Practical problems. Innovative ideas are put to practice in many projects. Such industrial activity provides students with adequate exposure in tackling real life problems encountered in the working of an industrial entity. The companies also gain from the fresh perspective and inputs of the students as also bettering their profile among the general student community.

Often various talks/workshop/seminars/conference are held by eminent speakers and experts. Conference/Symposium/Seminars are of national level are organized at SCET with participation from students, academicians, industry and research organization.

Students are regularly exposed to the latest industrial practices through several industrial visits. The academic curriculum also requires a student to undergo industrial training for four weeks at the end of the 6th semester of B. E. Degree programmes. The training provides students with an understanding of the problems encountered in the working of an industry.

Specific short term courses are also customized to cater the need of students like “C-Language Programming”, “Linux- Open-Source tool”.
